धर्म एव हतो हन्ति धर्मो रक्षति रक्षितः
तस्माद्धर्मो न हन्तव्यो मा नो धर्मो हतोऽवधीत् ॥

Overview

Cosmic Yang-Mills fields

There is a recent proposal by Daniel Friedan to explain the early cosmological epoch as a coupled Einstein-Yang-Mills-Higgs system with a SU(2) gauge field in a conformally flat background. A SO(4)-symmetry is imposed on the system that makes the Higgs field vanish. The proposal only works until the Electroweak energy scale after which SO(4)-symmetry is violated and the Higgs field rolls down to it's minima as shown in the figure on the left. Explicit time-dependent solutions for the scale-factor and the remaining scalar field (after the symmetry is imposed on the gauge field) are given in terms of two different sets of anharmonic oscillators. We have analysed the linear stability of such solutions against arbitrary linear perturbations in a recent work. The time-dependent eigenmodes that arise after linearising the Yang-Mills equations depend on the su(2) spin values 'j' and needs to be analysed for different spin cases. We have used the Floquet analysis to study the stability behaviour of these modes for upto j=2 and found that they are all unstable.

Electromagnetic knots

The study of electromagnetic knots—those EM fields whose field-lines form closed non-trivial knots like the ones shown on the left—have been an important topic for theoretical physicists ever since Antonio F. Rañada first introduced them in 1989. Quite recently, some of these simple knot configurations, including the one with figure-eight topology, have been realized experimentally using laser beams with knotted polarization singularities. A new method of contructing families of these knot solutions a de Sitter-Minkowski conformal correspondence was recently proposed that would complement the other existing methods.

List of Publications

For a good overview of my published works, including citations, I would urge you to visit my InspireHEP or arXiv profile. Below I list my publications for a ready reference.
  1. Kaushlendra Kumar, Gabriel Picanço Costa, Lukas Hantzko Conserved charges for rational electromagnetic knots arXiv:2106.05952 [math-ph].
  2. Kaushlendra Kumar, Olaf Lechtenfeld, Gabriel Picanço Costa Instability of cosmic Yang-Mills fields arXiv:2102.08401 [hep-th].
  3. Kaushlendra Kumar, Olaf Lechtenfeld On rational electromagnetic fields Phys. Lett. A 384 (2020) 126445, arXiv:2002.01005 [hep-th].
  4. Kaushlendra Kumar, Biswajit Chakraborty Spectral distances on doubled Moyal plane using Dirac eigen-spinors Phys. Rev. D 97 (2018) 086019,
    arXiv:1711.00653 [math-ph].
  5. Yendrembam C. Devi, Kaushlendra Kumar, Biswajit Chakraborty, Frederik G. Scholtz Revisiting Connes' Finite Spectral Distance on Non-commutative Spaces : Moyal Plane and Fuzzy Sphere Int. J. Geo. Meth. Mod. Phys. 15 (2018) 1850204.
  6. Kaushlendra Kumar, Shivraj Prajapat, Biswajit Chakraborty On the role of Schwinger's SU(2) generators for Simple Harmonic Oscillator in 2D Moyal plane Eur. Phys. J. Plus 130 (2015) 120, arXiv:1312.3095 [math-ph].
